page.title: 02THE POPULATION OF WHALTON
page.content:
This survey block has a population of around{215}of which{158}live in Whalton village itself. Of the total people living in this survey block,{58}are over 65 years old, whilst only{36}are under 18. In former times most villagers worked in the immediate vicinity but now only{31} people are employed in and around the village, almost all in agriculture.
Housing is particularly expensive in Whalton because of it being an attractive, rural village within easy travelling distance of the Tyneside conurbation. Consequently houses are frequently sold to professional families from outside rather than to young people from the village itself.
